verses.roman:
yatas tvam āgato durgaṁ
nistīryeha yad-icchayā
sarvaṁ no brūhy aguhyaṁ cet
kiṁ kāryaṁ karavāma te

synonyms: yataḥ—from which place; tvam—you; āgataḥ—have come; durgam—the impassable sea; nistīrya—crossing; iha—here; yat—with what; icchayā—desire; sarvam—everything; naḥ—to Us; brūhi—please tell; aguhyam—not secret; cet—if; kim—what; kāryam—work; karavāma—may We do; te—for you.
translation: Whence have you come, crossing the impassable sea, and for what purpose? Explain all this to Us if it is not a secret, and tell Us what We may do for you.
